column1: Interesting(?): Cannot find much on the BSDs vulnerabilities, so we cannot report. But we can say we observe packages present in ecosystems we don't have in the dasea dataset, e.g. the OS stuff + cocoapods, therefore they do potentially spread accross ecosystems? However, we need to address that issue with vulnerabilities info scattered amoung various sources, or not available for the smaller ecosystems (Clojars, BSDs, Alire, etc.)

column6: Ubuntu, Debian, npm, Maven, Clojars is not included in Snyk, RubyGems packages somehow the JS package under a different name so it has different source code, but also suffers from the same vulnerability

Why we did not catch grpc in conan/vpkg? URL issue maybe? Name there is grpc too
Yes, URL issue, conan has link: https://github.com/grpc/grpc
But we can confirm this package vulnerabilities propagate across NPM and C/C++. Maven we don't have dataset, but we can see potentially there 2
BTW also vulnerabilities match in versions of the cross-ecosystem packages as well, but not always.
